annotation.TEXT: Hmm... My sword can't seem to cut that Buzzy. Let's fix that problem, by turning on the All Weapons Pierce cheat!
So, what Extra Checkpoints does is adds a halfway point to levels that don't normally have one, which are the castles, world 8 levels, and worlds 9 through D levels in The Lost Levels... I think...
Oh, and I do believe I've now shown off every single cheat that I've unlocked! (But, if I accidentally overlooked one, let me know!)
Alright, I think it's about time I used someone else. Let's go with Luigi. And, I think I'll pick a random skin.
Okay, so you see how I can freely change which direction I'm moving in midair like this?
Also, I'll turn on Extra Checkpoints as well while I'm here, and I'll demonstrate how that works later.
Ooh, Peachy.
Let's try that again! (Whoops, I hit Enter by accident there, which mutes the music on the character select screen.)
Don't mind me. I'm just killing spiders and stuff while I try to remember what I wanted to show next.
I was seriously tempted to grab those two coins there, but that would've been highly risky!
Oh, but I'm gonna eventually run out of NP if I keep spamming my subweapon. However... There's a cheat that'll fix that problem!
Okay, this time, I'll be more careful, and get out of harm's way when the star is about to end.
Also, before I forget, I want to turn off All Hammer Bros. now, so 8-2 isn't flooded with those duders.
Demo count: 2 x 0
SPLUT! Cool, the Screw Attack did get some use!
Yeah, because the enemies are already loaded into the level, and won't just instantly change upon activating this cheat. I wonder if entering the bonus room will make it work...
Gimme that mushroom!
Ack! Once again, Bass gets bamboozled by a kicked shell that doesn't want to fall into a 1-tile pit near a wall. Fortunately, I had an extra hit that time.
Alright, time for another character. Now, no one voted for this guy, but I'm going to pick Simon now for a specific reason.
Well, that just happened. Let's try that again, shall we?
Shut up, clock. I'm nearly there.
Ah, there we go! The enemies have become Hammer Duders! ...Oh, man. This is dangerous. Maybe I should use projectiles.
Demo count: 1 x 0
NOTICE: I've removed the content ID matched audio from this point to about 5:00.

Huh, so Water Mode even affects the character select screen, preventing Luigi from jumping over that wall. Oh, and since I had Extra Checkpoints active, and got far enough in 8-1, which normally has no checkpoints, I start here instead of at the beginning!
But, I don't want to just cheese everything with the Invincible cheat, so let's try out Water Mode!
Now, let's try out another cheat... Evil Hammer Bros! Mwahaha!
However, I've decided that I'm going to show all of the remaining cheats I've unlocked in this episode, so there's really no need to show those voting results. Now, let's start with Haggle Man here.
Demo count: 8 x 0

And that'll do it for all of the cheats! ...Well, all of the ones I've unlocked anyway. There's still that locked one at the top of the cheat list, and that requires me to beat all of the map sets on Hard.
Oh, and even with the Everyone Can Stomp cheat, I'm pretty sure I still can't stomp certain things like piranha plants. (And unfortunately, I don't think there's a cheat that allows that.)
I think I'll keep using Luigi for a little longer.

Alright, I got missiles, and... Huh, I thought I just had to press the "special" button to fire missiles, but instead, the "special" button toggles whether or not the "attack" button shoots regular shots or missiles (while changing my color palette while the missiles are armed), just like in the original Metroid.
D'oh! I pressed my luck too much there and hit a "Double Whammy"! So, not only did I lose all my cash, but I'm now covered in silly string as well!
Oh, doy. I just figured out what's happening. Silly brain fart. The way the missile toggling works, and the inability to kneel are the result of the Classic Samus cheat.
Well, at least All Weapons Pierce is still helping me out. I hope I get a missile pickup so that I can abuse Infinite Ammo too.
Alright, I'm going to turn off the Invincible cheat now, and try to play through 8-2 more fairly. But, I'll leave Water Mode on for the time being.

D'oh, I forgot to dash jump from the top of the staircase there, but I still got 6 fireworks at least. (So, if I did remember to dash jump, I probably would've finished with the timer's ones digit at 7 instead.)
Nice! Also... Mmm... Doughnuts... (*Drools*)
Argh! I jumped right into that unexpected bullet...
Oh, you know what? There are no Hammer Bros. guarding the star, since the nearest ones just fell into the abyss, so I'm gonna grab the star and have some fun!

Oh, man. They're coming for me! So, what this cheat does is it causes the Hammer Bros. to walk towards you, as if you left them alone for a long time or if you're in world 7 or later of The Lost Levels.
Skeletal koopas go down the hole.
But! There's an app for that! Let's try out the Everyone Can Stomp cheat next! (Also, I'm switching to the other Haggle Man here.)
Oh, yeah. Now I remember. I'm gonna turn All Hammer Bros. back on for a moment here.

Whoa! Okay, I believe I mentioned this in the past, but for whatever reason, when two kicked shells collide in Crossover, only one is killed. (I think this has already been mentioned on the forums too.)
Yeah, with the cheat disabled, I can kneel, and I can just simply fire missiles with the "special" button, instead of toggling whether they're armed or not.
Ooh, Screw Attack. Maybe that'll get some use later on in this level.
Come on, Bass. Get up there.
Demo count: 5 x 0
Oh, and Evil Hammer Bros. too... Well, actually, I guess I'll leave that cheat turned on for now. There normally aren't any HBs in 8-2, but 8-3 has some, and I might play that level today.
NOTICE: I've removed the content ID matched audio from this point to about 8:56.
Aw, too bad there isn't an All Weapons cheat, because I kinda want to get more use out of Infinite Ammo, but that mushroom is the only power up in this level.
Ha, you guys can't hurt me, because I'm using the Invincible cheat! ...Wait, should I be bragging about that?
Whoopsiedoodle!
Alright, can I perfectly line up everything at the flagpole?
Just trying out the missile thing with Classic Samus disabled here.
This is obviously a nasty combination with the All Hammer Bros. cheat!
Aha, I'm still at 10 lives! So, I can now keep dying until the raocows come home and still never get a Game Over!
Demo count: 7 x 0
Doing things like stomping bullets is gonna be trickier now!
However, some of them may just fall down a hole. LOL.

So, who knows when I'll decide to start playing Hard mode, but you guys can feel free to vote for which map set you want me to play first (SMB, Special, or Lost Levels), and which characters I should use! This is SomeGuy712x, signing off. Have a good day!
Oh, man. Time limit. I'd better stop dawdling.
Okay, be very careful. I kinda don't want to die right now.
Now, for non-swimming characters like Bass, Water Mode just allows for higher jumps.
BARF!!! Well, I could try to bomb jump up, but I'm almost out of time, so I don't think that's an option.
Now, the Hammer Bros. cheats are still active, which reduces Peach's life expectancy down to roughly 5 seconds. However, maybe I can change that by using another cheat!
Also, I'll disable Water Mode now, and turn on Invincible just briefly while I deal with these HBs.
Let's try out the Classic Simon cheat now...
Yeah, I'd better get 5000 dollars plus a spin... Er, I mean 5000 points plus 6 fireworks while Water Mode is active!
Yeah, with Classic Samus disabled, I can Morph Ball in midair. Hmm... Are there any other differences?
Oh, man. Even the piranha plant turned into a Hammerin' Dude!
However, there are certain enemies that won't become Hammer Bros., such as Lakitu. But, Lakitu will end up tossing Hammer Bros. with the cheat active!
Now let's try jumping on something!
And, I guess I'll take out Lakitu while I'm at it. (Umm... Shouldn't I turn Invincible back off now? I thought I was gonna play 8-2 more fairly...)
Demo count: 3 x 0
Yada, yada. Now first, let's turn on Infinite Lives, because it's likely that I'll die multiple times in this episode.
Demo count: 6 x 0
Yes, missiles!
COINS!!!
Let's see if I can figure out what's different with Classic Samus active. Hmm... Looks like I can't Morph Ball in midair now, when I normally could...
So, as long as I'm not an idiot, and I'm paying attention, I should be able to avoid the mess of hammers down below!
Demo count: 4 x 0
Alright, I'm disabling Invincible now.
Next, let's activate another cheat... I'm thinking... All Hammer Bros! Yeah! However, I think the level has to be refreshed before it'll take effect.
At least I'm getting some good use out of Infinite Ammo now!
Too bad I don't have a better subweapon, but whatever.
Oh, well. I showed off what I wanted to with Simon (Trevor?) anyway. Now let's go with Samus next!
Ow, my waterlogged shoes! Yeah, apparently, just like in regular water levels, you can't stomp anything while Water Mode is active. That's a bummer.

Nah, I didn't think that would work, because going into a side area in doesn't refresh the main area (and vice versa) in Crossover. I guess I'll have to either die or clear the level first. I choose... death!
Ha, those ghostly bullets are no match for my piercing weapon!
Oh, um... That's right... The characters that aren't Italian plumbers don't have the feet for stomping.
Alright, time to use a different character. Now, while Bill did receive a vote, I think I've been overusing him lately, so I'm not going to use him at all today. Let's go with Bass this time.
Oh, sure. Now it falls down the hole.
Ha! Now I can smack armored enemies with whatever attack I want! Let's celebrate by stomping stuff!
Whoops, I didn't mean to drop bombs there.

God, I HATE this freaking annotation editor's glitchiness! I had to redo every annotation after this one because it stopped saving properly at this point, and I didn't notice until I got to the end of the video! Google, you done screwed up!
Ha! You guys cannot harm me now! I am invincible!
KA-BOOOOM!!! Too bad there's no Power Bomb weapon for Samus to use in Crossover, but that would be kinda overpowered, I think.
Hmm... The game picked Trevor? for me to use.
As for the cheat-related voting results, you guys did vote for a bunch of things.
NOOO!!!
I guess I could take advantage of the Infinite Ammo cheat while I'm using Trevor? here.
In fact, just to make sure nothing bad happens for the rest of 8-1, I'm turning on the Invincible cheat, because I've been in this level long enough, and I want to move onto 8-2 now.

Whoa, that felt like a risky dash jump to me there. If I screwed up, well... I probably would've restarted about halfway into this level, though I don't know exactly where the checkpoint would put me.

So, what's next? ...I guess I'll just play through the rest of the level with the currently active cheats, which I think are Infinite Lives, Infinite Ammo, Extra Checkpoints, Evil Hammer Bros., All Weapons Pierce, and Everyone Can Stomp.
So, as you can see, what Water Mode does is makes the game act like you're always underwater, which allows certain characters to swim in midair, while giving the non-swimmers higher jumps.
Alright, let's begin this level by stomping this parakoopa here at the start... Assuming I can aim properly...
Aw, I thought I could get 2000 with Samus's jump height from the flagpole's base there. Oh, well. At least we get fireworks.
(In Laharl's voice) Haaahahahahahahaha!!!
Samus's slightly lower gravity is kinda neat when you're stomping stuff.

Yeah, now I'm committed to the direction I'm moving when I jump... sorta. I can still change my jumping direction with my double jump, kind of like how Arthur can in Super Ghouls & Ghosts. (Speaking of which, maybe there should be an Arthur skin for Simon.)
COINS!!!
There we go. Next, let's give this cheat a little demonstration... (Remember that I began this episode with 10 lives.)
Now, just like with Simon, there's also a Classic Samus cheat. Let's activate that now.
Yes, Infinite Ammo! Now I can spam my projectiles until the raocows come home and still never run out!
Wait, I thought I could kneel down to fire shots lower to the ground, but I'm now going straight into Morph Ball mode with just one press of the down button.
Yeah, with All Hammer Bros. active, Lakitu tosses Hammer Guys, which can obviously get out of hand quickly! Alright, turn that cheat back off now.
WAH!!! Whelp, Haggle Man just got hammered.
Hello, and welcome back to more SMB Crossover! Sorry that it's been a while since last time. Anyway, up above are the character voting results, which include 1 alt. skin vote for Haggle Man (Ryu).
Awesome combo! (8 kills)
Now, will there be Hammer Guys everywhere?
